head.title: Seeing Patriotism In a Fresh Light

hedline.hl1: Seeing Patriotism In a Fresh Light

abstract.p: Ralph Kessler letter applauds patriotism's apparently coming back into style (July 1 article)

block.p: After reading Norman Podhoretz's comment about patriotism's slowly coming back into style (Arts & Ideas pages, July 1), I'd like to give an example from my own life.
After reading Norman Podhoretz's comment about patriotism's slowly coming back into style (Arts & Ideas pages, July 1), I'd like to give an example from my own life.
I am a 79-year-old union proofreader with a familiar trajectory, from The Daily Worker in 1936 to Commentary in 2000.

Now, I am putting my affairs in order, and I have been debating how I will leave the mortal coil: Should I donate my body to a medical school, or have a veteran's funeral, for which my service in World War II makes me eligible?

In the end I decided on a soldier's funeral. I want to be buried with an American flag on my last journey. As a former Communist, I can express my hatred of Communism and my love of the United States by having the American flag resting beside my body.
Yes, after the long night, patriotism is returning.
